attributes.action: Force companies that supply facts with AI to admit in clear text it may be wrong
attributes.additional_details: People with learning disabilities or the elderly could easily mistake the AI summaries as facts. This is not always the case. Many of these AI generators are sourced from online forums that often may joke with stupid, implausible ideas. One example is when Google Gemini started to tell people that glue would help stick cheese to pizza or people should eat a small rock each day. These big company’s are trusted and should not supply wrong information.
attributes.background: Force websites that are accessible in the uk to admit that the artificial intelligence used on them, like google’s Gemini or ChatGPT, to a have a notice in easily visible text to say that the AI may be delivering that the information is wrong

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Make a criminal offence not to label AI generated media & communication as such
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/715706
